intro: Aristeguietia pseudarborea, commonly known as the Andean cloud forest tree, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the cloud forests of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and dense canopy of broad, leathery leaves. It plays a vital role in the ecosystem by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species. Due to its ecological importance, it is often found in protected areas and is threatened by deforestation.
